title: Boston bombing suspects came from abroad
content:
The president delivered remarks shortly after 10 p.m. Eastern . Obama praises Boston arrest
President Barack Obama on Friday night praised the people of Massachusetts for their response to the bombings at the Boston Marathon that killed three people and wounded more than 100 .
“ Tonight our nation is in debt to the people of Boston and the people of Massachusetts , ” Obama said from the White House briefing room after police arrested the remaining suspect in the bombing , . “ After a vicious attack on their city , Bostonians responded with resolve and determination . ”
Obama said the suspects “ failed because the people of Boston refused to be intimidated . ”
“ And they failed because we , as Americans , refused to be terrorized . ”
Obama admitted the nation had gone through a rough past seven days , referring to the attacks in Boston and an explosion in West , Texas that killed dozens and leaving unmentioned poison-laced letters sent to him and a U.S. senator .
“ All in all , this has been a tough week , but we have seen the character of our country once more , ” Obama said . “ As president , I ’ m confident that we have the courage and the resolve and the spirit to overcome these challenges . ”
A senior Justice Department official confirmed to ███ that Boston Police have suspect Dzhokhar Tsarnaev in custody Friday night . The Associated Press reported that he was in serious condition at a local hospital .
“ Tonight , we ’ re all going to rest easy , ” Massachusetts Gov . Deval Patrick said at a press conference following the arrest .
“ The citizens of the city of Boston can be confident that the threat has been removed , ” Boston Police Commissioner Ed Davis said .
Davis said Dzhokhar was arrested after a homeowner in suburban Watertown , Mass . noticed blood outside of his boat . Lifting the tarp covering it , the homeowner discovered a hiding Dzhokhar and called police , who surrounded the boat before arrest Dzhokhar .
The suspect was apparently wounded Friday night while battling police . The Associated Press reported Dzhokhar fired shots from the boat .
Obama praised the response of the FBI and local police .
content_original:
The president delivered remarks shortly after 10 p.m. Eastern. Obama praises Boston arrest

President Barack Obama on Friday night praised the people of Massachusetts for their response to the bombings at the Boston Marathon that killed three people and wounded more than 100.

“Tonight our nation is in debt to the people of Boston and the people of Massachusetts,” Obama said from the White House briefing room after police arrested the remaining suspect in the bombing,. “After a vicious attack on their city, Bostonians responded with resolve and determination.”

Story Continued Below

Obama said the suspects “failed because the people of Boston refused to be intimidated.”

“And they failed because we, as Americans, refused to be terrorized.”

( PHOTOS: Boston celebrates capture)

Obama admitted the nation had gone through a rough past seven days, referring to the attacks in Boston and an explosion in West, Texas that killed dozens and leaving unmentioned poison-laced letters sent to him and a U.S. senator.

“All in all, this has been a tough week, but we have seen the character of our country once more,” Obama said. “As president, I’m confident that we have the courage and the resolve and the spirit to overcome these challenges.”

A senior Justice Department official confirmed to POLITICO that Boston Police have suspect Dzhokhar Tsarnaev in custody Friday night. The Associated Press reported that he was in serious condition at a local hospital.

“Tonight,we’re all going to rest easy,” Massachusetts Gov. Deval Patrick said at a press conference following the arrest.

( Also on POLITICO: Obama reassures after 'tough week')

“The citizens of the city of Boston can be confident that the threat has been removed,” Boston Police Commissioner Ed Davis said.

Davis said Dzhokhar was arrested after a homeowner in suburban Watertown, Mass. noticed blood outside of his boat. Lifting the tarp covering it, the homeowner discovered a hiding Dzhokhar and called police, who surrounded the boat before arrest Dzhokhar.

The suspect was apparently wounded Friday night while battling police. The Associated Press reported Dzhokhar fired shots from the boat.

Obama praised the response of the FBI and local police.
